item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description:
Summary

“Atomic Habits” by James Clear is a comprehensive guide to making small changes in behavior that can lead to remarkable results over time. Clear presents a practical framework for understanding how habits form and how they can be changed, emphasizing the importance of systems over goals and identity-based habits over outcome-based habits.

item.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
item.description:
Summary

“Thinking, Fast and Slow” is a groundbreaking work by Nobel Prize-winning psychologist Daniel Kahneman that explores the two systems of thought that drive the way we think. System 1 is fast, intuitive, and emotional; System 2 is slower, more deliberative, and more logical. Through decades of research, Kahneman reveals the cognitive biases that affect our decision-making and judgment.
